comment: Professor Page's class was a mixed bag - the content wasn't too difficult, but his teaching style could be hit or miss. Using unstuck ai and the textbook helped me stay on top of the weekly assignments and prepare for the tests.

He did help me so much with this class. I have dealt with some bad health issues including endometriosis and nutritional deficiencies and my dog died this semester. He went out of his way to help me when he didn't have to. The class is lecture heavy but they help the tests. Also assignment due on Fridays and attendance is mandatory. 10/10 professor

The class itself isn't hard hard however the professor is awful. I have never had a professor as bad as him before. If you miss 7 classes= automatic fail. Even if you are sick. If you do not have a doctor's note you are not excused. The other teachers told me not to come in He doesn't help you understand anything. He only reads off the powerpoint.

He is the best professor I've taken. Plenty of extra credit and his hybrid day just consisted of logging on to a page and watching a video. There is an online assignment due every Friday, but it takes only 15 mins. The tests will be easy if you just pay attention during the lectures. He even gave 5 points to everyone who was present the last day.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Very easy class, just do the homework and you'll be fine. His lectures can be a boring at times but he's super nice once you get to know him. Try to make conversation with him before class and he'll be very willing to help you if needed. Do the study guide with the text book because the powerpoints are missing info.
This class was fairly easy, the workload wasn't too much. Grades fairly. Would definitely recommend.

The content of this class was not hard, but Dr. Page became oddly aggressive after course evals were over. As soon as finals season hit, he refused to work with any students, blatantly said not to "beg" for a grade, and was clearly in a hurry to go on whatever vacation he had planned. Luckily this was my last semester, but he was only okay at best.
Gave no feedback on assignments and his emails were borderline hostile the way he gave information. The tests pulled questions from so many course mateiral it made studying almost impossible.

Not sure if he's like this in person but he just DRONES in his lecture videos, he uses previous class content which is fair enough in his current situation but a little disheartening considering I was majoring in Geography. His lectures do give some details that will be on the tests but honestly, you're better off just reading the study guides.

He is an OK professor at best. Lockdown Browser with webcam for the Tests. There's a mastering assignment due every week. There are two discussions and one paper that is separated into different sections throughout the semester. I corrected him on an assignment and requested to fix my grade - he was not happy about that.

Dr. Page is the absolute best! He makes his class super interesting and gives tons of opportunities for extra credit from day one. Around 4 tests, 4 discussion posts, and weekly homework. He's always available outside of class and willing to help anyone! Can't recommend enough.
nothing against the guy he's actually cool just different ways of learning and different ways of teaching
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: His class is easy, but his lectures can be boring. As an older teacher, he has a lot of knowledge and fun stories to tell you. Make sure to read the textbook, do the online homework, and use his note outlines and review guides.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Was an easy A. He was confusing at times, but as long as you did assignment you were fine. One essay and he grades nicely. Weekly easy homeworks. Tests were exactly like study guides. Good class for an easy A.

He is a very nice man and has a lot to say but his lectures were very boring... This class is pretty easy there's easy homework assignments and 4 tests but the hardest part is showing up to class. Attendance is mandatory and he fails u automatically if you miss 7 classes. Just don't take this class in general the material is very boring

His lectures are the best part about the class. He makes what he talks about interesting and he gives really good life advice. He is very clear about his guidelines and you earn the grade you get. All assignments were online and fairly simple. There was one research paper that wasn't too bad. Loved going to class everyday to listen to him.
pretty easy class if you show up and takes notes. Dont skip homework, it takes a little time but its easy and is a big part of the grade.

Professor Page was a good prof and likes to talk, he knows his stuff. This is not an easy A and pass-class. The class is lecture HEAVY and it is expected of you to read the book and STUDY, it's a lot of material. NO FINAL, 4 tests, 1 paper (2-3 pages), and 1 assignment each week. Besides going to class, everything is online including the test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Page made his lectures fun and his class easy. He understood that level that his class was and that the majority of students are taking it for a gen ed credit. He made it clear that he was not there to fail us but just teach and help us out. We had 5 graded assignments. One was extra credit it was optional. The others were test.

4 exams taken online with lockdown browser, no monitor. You'll need to purchase an Iclicker (I don't recommend the app) for daily participation credit. Exams were simple and based on textbook material. Extra credit essay opportunity, but it was really not necessary. Fill out chapter outlines and read the textbook for an A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Blew through power points and did not post them. The book did not mention things he discussed and he spoke too quietly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: lecture heavy. outlined the chapters online, and uses a powerpoint everyday, not miserable because he is funny. Attendance isnt mandatory but he requires and iclicker to answer q's on the board with, attendance is taken with those and counted towards grade. your phone makes noise then you dance. tests online and not monitored:))))))).

The course consists of four tests and they are all online. He gives amazing lectures and always answers your questions when asked. However, attendance is a grade! You have to purchase the iclicker and answer four questions a day as part of your grade. He also offers an extra grade assignment to help add up to 30 points on your grade.
Very easy class. Test and other assignments are straight forward.

eh boring. pretty easy. all test answers can be found online, but you have to search hard for them. you will definitely pass with a B. and work a little hard to make an A. overall pretty easy you just have to go to class for iclicker

Extremely boring lectures, used iclicker to record attendance. Tests are super detailed and on book not lecture. emailed him with question asking to explain something and he was extremely rude about it. Then I replied asking another question that I was not clear on and he pretty much yelled at me through email and told me to figure it out on my own
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: He gives a one paragraph essay as extra credit before every test. Easy A. Tests are online. Gives 3 questions through iClicker remote every day as a grade, but attendance isn't mandatory. No homework.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The lectures are pretty okay, but basically useless for the tests (online using Lock Down Browser, camera and all!) The tests themselves consist of extremely specific questions with vague answers. I'd suggest reading the book, but that doesn't give you a clear answer either. iClicker takes daily attendance and pop quizzes. Will never take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor Page is a great professor. He has so many cool stories that he mentions throughout the semester. There is a group project that the lowest grade you can get is a 90 and then there are a few tests and 1 paper. MAKE SURE YOUR PHONES ARE ON SILENT! If your phone goes off, he will make you dance in front of the whole class LOL.
easy class. midterm, final, group presentation and analysis paper. takes attendance based off iclicker questions during every day lectures. super funny guy, cracks a lot of jokes during class

Good professor, the class can get boring, but overall Professor Page knows his stuff and he makes quite a few jokes during class. Not many things to be graded by. We had a group presentation, which is graded by the class, analysis paper, midterm, final, and questions/attendance that we answered during the power point.

He's changed his curriculum. We now have 2 in-class exams that ask excruciatingly detailed questions. If you want to get an A, you have to read the book. I personally think that it's way too much work for a general education course, I wished I had taken something else.
Only four exams, all online. I-Response questions three times a class, every class. Questions are based off of the mastering videos. Easy class, never studied.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: He seems to care about his students. Made us take iClicker quizzes every class which was very annoying. However all of his tests are online so its very easy to use your notes and get an A.

If you can take this class, do it. You get points for showing up so you'll have to go but taking notes or paying any sort of attention is pointless. Theres no homework or classwork just online test (quizlet) ;). Great guy, highly recommend.

This professor gives online test that he encourages you to use the book and notes on. There are only the grades for tests and participation, in which he uses an I-clicker to do. He asks questions based on the videos on Mastering Geography. Would take again and show up more. The attendance is what skewed my grade.

This class was very easy. I almost missed half of the class and failed only one test badly. The test are very easy and are online. I never used the book. I could get an A easy, but i was slacking. I still pass. He gives you plenty of times to take the online test. TAKE HIM, YOU WILL NOT REGRET.

I didn't study all semester. Only four tests (online) but participation counts. The $15 app doesn't always work because of the bad signal, he claims, but regardless it's pretty fair grading. Not hard to pass. He's super funny and pretty relaxed during lecture.

Great professor! Very interesting lectures and makes a morning class worth it. He is also very kind and caring. I did not need to purchase a textbook because I found it online, only thing you need to purchase is the Reef app which is only $15. Would totally recommend taking him!

Easiest class ever. Take him if you can. The textbook is "required", but I got it and never used it. He has his tests online, and you don't have class the day of the test. He even said that the tests are open book. Attendance is required but he takes it by making you answer questions on an app. Just download the app and answer them at home. Easy A.

His lectures can be boring, but the tests are multiple choice and online. He is also very caring and accommodating. No homework, 4 tests including the final and participation are the only grades he counts.

I liked Professor Page, I just did not like his grading scale. Graded on 4 tests and attendance/participation. Participation is graded based off questions asked in class and if you miss the question, you don't get the points, which can really take a toll on your grade. Wish he had more assignments to balance your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I'm in love with Daniel Page. 10/10 recommend a man like this. Loves to re-tell stories but they get better every time. Has a bomb goatee and also had a pony tail in the 80s.

Easiest class I've ever taken! I was in a large class so he gave his tests online. 4 tests, no quizzes, no homework, no attendance. I went to class about 5 times and got an A+. TAKE HIM (p.s. I bought the book and never took it out of the box)

For a first time at teaching such a large lecture group he was AMAZING! You really should get the textbook. Four test, each covering the previous chapters covered during that lecture period, half of the test question do come from the chapters. Professor Page is fair and understanding he makes himself available for help. He LOVES geography!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He creates lecture guides, but his lecture doesn't follow the guide.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is a great professor and a really passionate lecturer of geography, however I found his class extremely difficult. You have to read the chapters or you won't pass the exams. This might unfortunately be my first C, therefore I will not be taking him again

Only like 4 tests in the class. I honestly showed up like 3 times during the semester. The ones I did he was a pretty cool guy. Just a boring subject, test were easy. Lowest  I made was an 82, then 98+ after I figured out as someone stated "EXTRA RESOURCES" helped immensely.  EASY A.
Take him it's that simple. he's low key hilarious and gives no homework

Geography with him was simple and easy. No homework, really, and no quizzes, just 4 tests as the grades. Tests were all online and easy if you knew the material. Glad I took this class, made my stressful first semester of college slightly less stressful. Long lectures, though.

He is a great man, but that's it. His test are very complex and if you don't know the material you won't pass. 4 test, a non cumulative final. I struggled the most with this class until I figured out by the second test that I had to use "EXTRA RESOURCES" during the test.  Even if you show up and pay attention it was still difficult to pass.

His intro level class took more time this semester to succeed than my advanced courses. He gets off topic very easily. His textbook is used a lot ,but has a lot of subjective information. His exams tend to be multiple choice ,but the answers aren't usually things discussed in class. Very important to read the chapters , it might help ,might not.

He's so easy. He doesn't give homework or anything only like 4 or 5 tests. The test are easy. just study and take great notes. The test are online ! you only have 60 mins so make sure you study good so you atlas know most of the answers before trying to look through the text book.

Took this class because I needed a GPA boost & this class was perfect. He will tell you he is a highschool teacher as well as college professor so this class is basically a highschool level GEO class. Super easy. Map quizzes every chapter, 2 tests, a final, & a group project. Would definitely take again

I didn't have to take his class, but was happy I did. Easy A if you put in the effort. Grade is 70% on 2 tests, 20 on 6 quizzes (drops lowest), and 10% EASY group project. He gives very interesting lectures, although I wish he would talk a bit louder. At times he can be politically bias towards the left at times, but it's not a problem.

Nice guy who has interesting stories. Tests are hard, but he is clear about what will be on them. Only 2 tests that are 75% of your grade and  I made Cs on both. I studied but used the Internet instead of the slides and my book, which was a mistake. DON'T trust the study guide answers online.  Presentation is easy and quizzes are pure memorization.

Hes pretty good. The lectures are kind of pointless, but you gotta show up not only for quiz and test days but the class after the quiz (takes attendance) and whenever theres a presentation. Other than that you can skip and still pass, though its best not to. He tells really interesting stories about his travels but otherwise lectures are boring.

He was a pretty soft spoken professor and would sometimes be hard to hear in a class of 90.  Class would be set up as him just reading from a powerpoint and giving personal examples if he had been to the country or not, so not exactly too important for the tests. Tests would be both map quiz in class and multiple choice questions online.

There are 6 mini geography quizzes. study the map that he gives you and you'll make a hundred. All online quizzes can be found online. Very easy class definitely take him. Doesn't really take attendance I only went on quiz and test days.

Take Dr. Page, you won't regret it, he is such an interesting guy with so many stories. The class was easy. 6 quizzes, 20 map questions  study the map he adds to d2l and 10 multiple choice online at home. a midterm with an essay, map and multiple choice and a final without the essay. He gives study guides and makes it easy for you to pass.

This man is awesome. Take his class on Monday and Wednesday night because he will let you out early on monday so he can watch Monday night football. You have map quizzes which are really easy and a mid term and final which he gives you the study guide for which is exactly like the test. He's cool to have a conversation with so talk to him. Take him

One presentation (can do it solo or with a partner) that was very easy.  Test every 2 weeks, but he gives a study guide of exactly what you need to know. Same for the final. Overall, I enjoyed going to his class and listening to his random stories. Funny Professor! Study the guides and you'll get an A. Dont buy the textbook

He's a High School teacher and the class is set up that way. Short map quizzes in class are easy if you study. Mid Term, Final (both w/ reviews), & an EASY group project EVERYONE makes an A on. Atlas mandatory for tests as portions are open book (atlas). Easy A with effort. No attendance.
He is a great professor, love to hear his stories. His map quizzes are very easy if you study and I would definitely take him again if I could.

He is a really cool dude. Kind of looks like Hershel from the Walking Dead, I think he is cute, although he is older. He is a very smart and educated man. I enjoy his class because he always incorporates a personal story which keeps it intersting. Easy class. Easy A. 2 tests and the rest quizes. TAKE HIM
Awesome teacher. Knows his stuff!

This class is so easy. Don't buy the textbook, only the atlas and you will be fine. Just do the study guide for the midterm and study for the map quizzes and you will make an A. Half the class doesn't show up anymore and I'm pretty sure everyone's rocking an A or B
He knows what he is talking about, although he likes to get off topic. You'll need to read the book and go to class or you will be really confused.
He is awesome. Knows his stuff. Gives great study guides. Map quizzes are easy. Doesn't care about attendance.
Cool guy, has a lot of stories from traveling.  Two tests (which he gives answers to) and some map quizzes.  If yoput in a little effort you can make a B.
I love him!! He is such a great teacher and does a fair job with testing.  Take Him

The best teacher to have.Gives you 6 on-line quizzes and maps test are done in class.  He really wants you to do well and he has a great sense of humor.  Now the class is kind of boring but he shares his stories on when he traveled. Take the class you wont regret it.

Definitely take this class. 6 easy online quizes combined with in class map quizes but he drops your lowest quiz grade. Midterm is huge portion of grade but if you look over the study guide you're golden, group project is automatic A. class is him reading off powerpoints and is SO boring but attendance isn't mandatory, overall take this class!

easy online quizzes and in class map quizzes, 1 xtremely easy group project. he has interesting stories, but if you don't care you will fall asleep. i stop showing up after awhile and still made an A. EASY A

Enjoyed his class a LOT! Mr. Page makes the topic interesting and relatable. His stories are funny, albeit sometimes off topic. Midterm and a final, 2-4 quizzes, and a paper. Easy class, just come to class because he sometimes calls on random people to answer a question for participation points! Loved his class.

He is a very interesting guy. I did not attend every class, but the ones I did attend were interesting. He makes the powerpoints interesting with the many side notes and stories he tells. No unit test. Just a mid term and final. I never used the book and had below average attendence and still came out with a B.

AWESOME professor!!!! There are various map quizzes 6 to be exact along with an online quiz.  His lectures are very entertaining and interesting. He knows geography very very well! He has also been on trips that you will see in the ppts. take the class it is so fun and one EASY group project!

Hilarious professor. Makes the class interesting with his stories. Two major tests (midterm and final) with essays and various map quizzes. Everything is based on his power points, so attending class is a must, even though it isn't mandatory.

Dan Page is a very helpful if you ever have questions. He is mainly a high school teacher so he uses methods that may seem elementary. This only makes the class easier than it already is. He tells many stories (not sure if they are all true), but he never fails to make the class fun. I highly recommend everyone to take him at least once.

He is a very nice teacher and understands that it is an 1101 class. He does not make the content too hard but you do have to study a little for the mid term and final if you are going to pass the class with a good grade. He is very nice and has cool stories to keep the class interesting.

I hate Geography but had to take it- I'm glad I got put with Mr. Page. The class is relatively easy; he tries to make it where you're not getting an easy A, but there's no reason you should fail his class! Funny and interesting, didn't want to miss a day!

He is a nice guy but the it was the first time he taught this class, so many things were unclear. i feel i may have learned more if i had taken this class from a different teacher. hes great for 1101 but im not sure i would recommend him for much else if you are a geog/gis major.
BRAVO!  BRAVO!  Excellent Professor.

Nice guy, super smart and great conversationalist, but that's it. If you are fresh out of high school and miss the coddling of your old teacher, then take his class. He will take you under his wing. If you are a seasoned student that needs intellectual stimulation in class:  AVOID!!

Mr. Page was by far the most interesting professor I have ever had. I honestly was motivated to go to class just to hear him talk. This guy has done so much with his life and has hundreds of stories to tell. His class is very easy too, and should be an easy A. I strongly recommend taking Mr. Page!
I loved this class.  Can't wait to take Page again next semester!

The quizes are map and you have to study them really well. The other half of quizes are online and you can use the internet. Sometimes the quizes mess up and you can't take it and they'll more than likely be a zero. READ THE BOOK. Take notes from the book. I didn't really listen to his lectures, but his stories are cool. Mid term and final are HARD

Interesting class, I had no desire to learn anything in this class until I heard his lectures.  He is fair and makes it intereting.  Mandatory attendance is not required but I never wanted to miss his class.  Read what you are suppose to and study for the map test and you should do well!

So many great stories. He has been all over the world and seen many cool things. i would say he is more than qualified to be teaching this class. if you put in no effort and still expect an A dont count on him to pitty you. its an easy class, he doesnt want to baby people through it.

i loved this teacher. i cant believe someone would say he was terrible. he makes the class easy to do well it. so it probably annoys him when people have issues. he does tell stories, but that is what keeps class interesting. yes he is a high school teacher by day but what night teacher isn't!? how rude to say that makes him less qualified!

Terrible!! Grades tests incorrectly, and then doesn?t correct them. Cannot use technology properly; 3 out of 5 online quizzes did not work. Oh, and be aware, although you are paying the same tuition, he does not have a doctorate; he is a former truck driver who is a high school teacher by day, and teaches at KSU part time at night.

Comes off as an easy going hippie type, but I've seen this guy talk down to students, and make examples of students personal issues and ability.  He talks about himself way too much, the class is nothing but Power Points. I can't stand this guy, but anyone looking for an easy grade will probably like him.  In my opinion he is a 2nd rate jerk.

Cool old guy with a lot of fun stories. His voice is a kind of soothing and sedative, so I'd recommend some coffee for class if you're prone to dozing off. He's a learned fellow with a lot to say about his subject and life in general. The tests are pretty much a breeze, just make sure you study. Highly recommended.
IF YOU WANT AN A TAKE THIS CLASS
everyone loves dan page! highly recommended.

What a cool guy. Has all sorts of stories from the past, very funny. SUPER EASY!! 6 easy map quizzes, 2 tests (for which the study guides are question for question the test), all notes online. So easy you really only need to show up for tests and quizzes, but he is just too interesting to skip the class.
The *only* difficult or objectionable thing about this class is how the midterm and the final make up an overwhelming majority of your grade.
He's an awesome teacher.  He's funny, and if you show up to class look over the study guides he gives out for the 2 major tests, you'll do well.  Highly recommended!
Fabulous prof!  I highly recommend him.  He makes learning geography interesting, and he doesn't give "gotcha" tests.

Great guy, and a really interesting teacher.  His lectures are straight from his powerpoints, and he gives really comprehensive study guides for the 2 big tests (mid-term and final.)  There is one group project with a guaranteed A.  Take him if you get the chance!

He is extremely easy. You have 6 quizes every other week. 20 map id questions and 10 mulitple choice. he gives the study guide to the quizes. he drops the lowest quiz. One Mid term which he gives you the study guide. you have one group project on powere point and gives you a stright up 100 if you show up. People take him so easy. you get an A

The professor uses to many powerpoint slides.  The class is very boring.  He needs to use material that is directly related to the course being taught.  He is also very cold and unconcerned about the status of the students.  His main concern is covering all the required chapters and not if the students are comprehending the material.
Super nice guy. Tests were kind of confusing, but he wants you to do good in the class. LOTS of material to learn.
